Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek pottery oenochoe, glazed black on the exterior with incised tongues alternating red, black, white. Added red and white also for the narrow bands below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Compare the oinochoai excavated at Vroulia (K.F. Kinch, "Fouilles de Vroulia" [Berlin, 1914] pp.190-93, pl.11 figs.2-3; fig.2 shows tongues alternating white/black/red/black/white; fig.3, white/red/white/red) and similar fragments from Larisa in Aeolia (J. Boehlau and K. Schefold, "Larisa am Hermos", vol.3: "Die Kleinfunde" [Berlin, 1942] pl.39 figs.3-4).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 48, no. 167 pl. 49)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 257)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.60)
